Package modules.boundary

Class ConsoleUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • modules.boundary.ConsoleUI
  • public class ConsoleUI
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents an user interface that manages input and output through the console It is instantiated when entering the app and passed down by controllers.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.lang.String ANSI_CYAN
      String that changes output messages to Cyan
      private java.lang.String ANSI_RED
      String that changes output messages to red
      private java.lang.String ANSI_RESET
      String that resets the color of output messages
      private java.text.SimpleDateFormat DATEFORMAT
      A requirement on date format
      private java.util.regex.Pattern EMAILPATTERN
      Regular expression to check the syntax of email
      private java.util.List<java.lang.String> movieStatusList
      All available movie status
      private java.util.Scanner sc
      Used to get input from user.
      private java.lang.String styleChar
      Characters that surround the text repeatedly

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ConsoleUI()
      Creates a new ConsoleUI with a user input scanner

      void logSeatPlan​(java.util.ArrayList<Ticket> ticketList, Show show)

      This is to print out success message and auto return to the previous page A sleep time of 2.5 seconds was set to allow the users to read

      Used to print out message with styleChar surrounded on top and bottom
      void logWarning​(java.lang.String outputMsg)

      • log

        public void log​(java.lang.String outputMsg)
        Used to print out the most basic, non-styled message
        Parameters:
        outputMsg - The string message to print out as line in console

      • logWarning

        public void logWarning​(java.lang.String outputMsg)
        Used to print out message in red color as warning
        Parameters:
        outputMsg - The string message to print out as line in console

      • logReminder

        public void logReminder​(java.lang.String outputMsg)
        Used to print out message in cyan as a reminder
        Parameters:
        outputMsg - The string message to print out as line in console

      • logText

        public void logText​(java.lang.String outputMsg)
        Used to print out message with styleChar surrounded on top and bottom
        Parameters:
        outputMsg - The string message to print out as line in console

      • logMenu

        public void logMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> menuItems)
        Used to print out a ArrayList with auto-indexes as a menu for users to select from
        Parameters:
        menuItems - The ArrayList of String to be printed by sequence

      • logMenu

        public void logMenu​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> menuItems,
                    java.lang.Boolean withOutIndex)
        Similar to logMenu, but print without or without index.
        Parameters:
        menuItems - The ArrayList of String to be printed by sequence
        withOutIndex - if equals to false, will call logMenu instead

      • logWithSeparator

        public void logWithSeparator​(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> records,
                             java.lang.String separator)
        This is used to print an ArrayList of String in sequence, but each element broke into lines by separator Mainly used to printout movie reviews
        Parameters:
        records - The ArrayList of String to be printed by sequence
        separator - The separator used to tokenize each elements of records

      • logSeatPlan

        public void logSeatPlan​(java.util.ArrayList<Ticket> ticketList,
                        Show show)

      • logSuccess

        public void logSuccess()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        This is to print out success message and auto return to the previous page A sleep time of 2.5 seconds was set to allow the users to read
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • getInt

        public int getInt​(java.lang.String label,
                  int lowerBound,
                  int upperBound)
        This is used to get an integer from users with a lowerBound and upperBound
        Parameters:
        label - The text to print out first as a instruction
        lowerBound - The minimum accepted value
        upperBound - The maximum accepted value
        Returns:
        the valid user input integer

      • getStr

        public java.lang.String getStr​(java.lang.String title)
        This is used to get a non-checked string from the user
        Parameters:
        title - The text to print out first as a instruction
        Returns:
        the user input string

      • getStr

        public java.lang.String getStr​(java.lang.String title,
                               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> validValues)
        This is used to get a checked string from the user, which is contained in a specified array list
        Parameters:
        title - The text to print out first as a instruction
        validValues - An ArrayList of String which contains all the valid values
        Returns:
        a valid user input string

      • getMovieStatus

        public java.lang.String getMovieStatus​(java.lang.String title)
        This is used to get a movie status from the user
        Parameters:
        title - The text to print out first as a instruction
        Returns:
        A valid user input movie type as string

      • getMovieId

        public int getMovieId​(java.lang.String title)
        This is to get a valid id of a existing movie which is not in "End Of Showing" status
        Parameters:
        title - The text to print out first as a instruction
        Returns:
        a valid movie id, entered by the user

        Returns:

      • getEmail

        public java.lang.String getEmail()
        This is used to get a valid email from the user
        Returns:
        A valid user input email address as string

      • getTime

        public java.lang.String getTime()
        This is used to get a time in "hh:mm" format in 24 hrs
        Returns:
        a valid time in "hh:mm" format, entered by the user

      • getDate

        public java.lang.String getDate()
        This is used to get a date in "dd/mm/yyyy" format
        Returns:
        a valid date in "dd/mm/yyyy" format, entered by the user

      • getPrice

        public double getPrice()
        This is used to get a valid price
        Returns:
        a valid price e.g. with format 0.00

      • getSeat

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getSeat​(java.lang.String cinemaName)
        This is used to get valid seat numbers according to cinema type (the first character of cinema name)
        Parameters:
        cinemaName - the name of a cinema e.g. a1
        Returns:
        the user entered seat numbers, separated with comma

        Called when the App ends to close the scanner
